title: WDK#35+#36: ContractTerm value field + KnownMatrix variant
description: Investigate VASP Stage 3 type extensions: what preconditions need machine-readable values beyond POTCAR family, and what Value variants cover VASP spectral data types (band structure, DOS, charge density)
close_reason: Investigation complete, findings appended to FINDINGS.md

title: WDK#41 S4.2: Regime validity — realistic parameter ranges from DSL trace outputs
description:
Session 4 swept parameter ranges chosen for coverage, not for correspondence to realistic DSL outputs. BF=1000, SE mult=10x, and d_mid=4.0 may never occur in practice, making those failure regions academic.

Investigation needed:
1. Survey the DSL environments ATHENA targets (OpenMM, GROMACS, CESM, VASP per ARCHITECTURE.md) for typical BayesFactor magnitudes, standard error ranges, and effect size distributions.
2. Define operating regime bounds: what are the realistic min/max for each component type (BF, Cohen-d, custom sigmoid inputs)?
3. Re-evaluate Session 4 failures against realistic bounds. If S1 SE mult=5x and S5 BF=120 are outside operating regime, document as accepted limitations rather than architectural risks.
4. If BF>110 IS realistic, this confirms athena-rfp (S5 ceiling) as a blocking architectural issue.

This informs both athena-rfp (ceiling analysis) and athena-6ax (recommendation). Can run in parallel with athena-rfp.

title: Implement AggregateScore acceptance test suite
description: Implement acceptance tests directly from Session 6 evidence: 7-scenario baseline margins must match aggregate_score_recommendation.json baseline_margins within 1e-6; resolved-risk regressions (S5 BF=1000 pass, S6 five recovered cells pass, S2 x0<0 rejection); accepted-boundary assertions for Pattern B step_ratio<3.0 and S1 SE_mult>=5.0 as documented limitations, not blocking failures.

title: Implement BF normalization seam for AggregateScore
description:
Expose bf_norm_log_scaled(bf, c) as a first-class configurable normalization hook in AggregateScore normalization flow, instead of hard-coded branch wiring. Locked default remains c=0.083647 (bf_max_target=10000). Source: aggregate_score_recommendation.md Section 1.2 and Section 6 note 1.

Acceptance criteria:
1) Normalization path supports injectable BF normalization function/seam.
2) Default behavior exactly matches locked log-scaled mapping with c=0.083647.
3) Non-BF normalization branches remain unchanged behaviorally.
4) Contract conformance demonstrated via acceptance tests in athena-3lu.
close_reason: Implemented and verified: BF norm seam, x0 guardrail, decomposition invariant. 7/7 PASS, max margin delta 4.414e-07

title: Step 3a: Map LFI audit to minimum IR requirements
description: Derive 17+ minimum semantic distinctions from ARCHITECTURE.md 5.3 three-stage audit. Stage 1: execution/exception/data-validation/numerical/resource events. Stage 2: observable/intervention/sampling/controlled-vars/DAG-linkage. Stage 3: prediction/observation/comparison. Cross-cutting: provenance, layer tags, temporal ordering, queryability. Deliverable: FINDINGS.md entry

title: WDK#41 Session 6: AggregateScore type recommendation for architecture integration
description: Write the formal recommendation that closes the adversarial-reward research question. Deliverable: a concrete AggregateScore type definition and aggregation function specification suitable for ARCHITECTURE.md integration. Must include: (1) recommended algorithm (HTG-gated Fisher product with specific parameters), (2) evidence summary citing Sessions 1-5 results, (3) known limitations and failure boundaries, (4) parameter sensitivity analysis, (5) conditions under which the recommendation should be revisited. This is the research-to-architecture handoff — not production code, but a specification another session can implement against. Depends on Sessions 4 and 5 confirming robustness.
close_reason: Session 6 complete: AggregateScore recommendation locked in aggregate_score_recommendation.md and .json. HTG-gated Fisher product hybrid with log-scaled BF normalization, x0>=0 guardrail, 4 resolved risks, 2 accepted limitations, 5 revisit triggers.

title: VASP adapter for LEL IR prototype
description: Build a VASP adapter (INCAR/OUTCAR/OSZICAR parsing) into LayeredEventLog, stress-testing ConvergencePoint and StateSnapshot variants that GROMACS/OpenMM never exercised. Validates What We Don't Know #12: whether one IR handles both DFT and MD codes without type changes. Follow the same pattern as the GROMACS adapter (Step 9). Create src/vasp_adapter.rs, add ~20 tests, update FINDINGS.md.

title: Step 1b: GROMACS trace format characterization
description: Survey GROMACS trace output: .log structure, .edr binary format, error/warning taxonomy, theory-implementation boundary (.mdp params, grompp compilation), constraint failure walkthrough. Deliverable: dsl-evaluation/gromacs-trace-analysis.md

title: Implement GR-S2-CUSTOM-SIGMOID-X0-NONNEG config validation
description:
Implement GR-S2-CUSTOM-SIGMOID-X0-NONNEG at NormalizationConfig construction/validation. For all custom_sigmoids entries require x0 >= 0. Reject invalid config with explicit error. No silent clamping. Source: aggregate_score_recommendation.md Section 1.4 and guardrail_spec.md.

Acceptance criteria:
1) Any x0 < 0 is rejected before aggregation run starts.
2) Error includes guardrail ID, offending method_ref, offending x0, and expected constraint text x0 >= 0.
3) No auto-correction/clamping path exists.
4) Guardrail behavior covered by acceptance tests in athena-3lu.
close_reason: Implemented and verified: BF norm seam, x0 guardrail, decomposition invariant. 7/7 PASS, max margin delta 4.414e-07

title: Hidden confounder litmus test end-to-end
description: Implement the evaluation spec from evaluation/hidden-confounder/README.md: plant a known confounder in a synthetic trace, run the full pipeline (adapter -> LEL -> CausalOverlay -> R14 detect_confounders), and verify correct detection. This is the first empirical validation that the IR's diagnostic value exceeds plumbing correctness — the stated success criterion in the trace-semantics research question.

title: WDK#41 Session 7: AggregateScore architecture integration
description: Integrate locked Session 6 AggregateScore recommendation into architecture contracts and handoff artifacts without changing algorithm decisions. Deliverables: ARCHITECTURE updates, ADR, acceptance-test specification, monitoring trigger specification, FINDINGS Session 7 log.
close_reason: Session 7 complete: ARCHITECTURE contract integrated (4.4.1/5.4/8.1+Appendix), ADR 002 created, acceptance-test and monitoring trigger specs added, FINDINGS Session 7 log appended, and implementation beads/dependencies established.

title: Step 5b: Prototype and evaluate most promising IR candidate
description: Build throwaway Python prototype: mock trace generator (3 failure scenarios), IR parser, LFI query demo. Evaluate: distinguishable representations, deterministic queries, linear efficiency, litmus test compatibility, Rust amenability. Deliverable: prototypes/ scripts + Prototype Index + final FINDINGS.md entry + updated Accumulated Findings
close_reason: Step 5b complete: Codex prompt written, crate implemented and verified (build/test/clippy all pass). LEL core types, OpenMM mock adapter, builders, 11 unit tests, Hybrid upgrade fields all validated.

title: WDK#41: Standardize profile aggregation into bounded monotonic reward scalar
description: How to standardize profile aggregation into a bounded, monotonic reward scalar that remains calibratable under ARCHITECTURE.md §5.4 feedback and robust against Noisy-TV style reward hacking. This bridges trace-semantics (ComparisonProfileV1) to adversarial-reward track. See FINDINGS.md WDK#41, Step 12 log.

title: Step 5a: Draft candidate IR schemas
description: Design 3 candidates: Layered Event Log (flat, Rust-friendly), Dual-Graph IR (spec vs execution graphs, divergence detection), Typed Assertion Log (assertion checking, streamable). Evaluate each against 17+ requirements, DSL trace characteristics, Rust compatibility, hidden confounder litmus test. Deliverable: FINDINGS.md entry
close_reason: Step 5a complete: candidate IR schemas with Hybrid LEL-DGR recommendation (94/100)

title: WDK#41 Session 4: Hybrid robustness under fixture perturbation
description: The hybrid achieved 7/7 on fixed fixtures, but S2 passes with only 7.28% margin driven largely by a single metric (s2.custom.1 at 0.582, next highest 0.382). Test whether 7/7 holds under: (1) resampled fixture noise levels, (2) correlated weak signals at varying rho, (3) alternative uncertainty-missingness patterns. If robustness fails, identify which scenarios are fragile and whether parameter adjustment or architectural change is needed. Key question: is the hybrid structurally robust or fixture-tuned?

title: WDK#41 Session 3: Hybrid aggregation candidate (HTG gating + Fisher/IVW compounding)
description:
Session 2 exhausted single-family tuning: HTG-Max 5/7, Fisher-UP 5/7 (isolation), IVW-CDF 2/7. No candidate reaches 7/7. Root cause: each candidate's failures are structural, not parametric. HTG gates well but discards compounding info (fails S2/S5/S6). Fisher compounds well but has no noise filter (fails S1). IVW averages and can never exceed max input (fails S2).

Session 3 designs a hybrid: HTG confidence gating as front end (noise filtering) + Fisher or IVW compounding as back end (signal accumulation), with IVW-style decomposition preserved for S6 calibration.

Acceptance criteria:
- Prototype hybrid candidate in aggregation-candidates/
- Run against all 7 scenarios, target 7/7 (or 6/7 with documented S2 sensitivity frontier)
- Decomposition property: sum(w_i * score_i) reconstructs aggregate within 1e-8
- Backward compat: evaluate.py with defaults still reproduces Session 1 results
- FINDINGS.md updated with Session 3 log entry

Key design question: does gated-Fisher decomposition produce well-defined per-component weights? Investigate before committing to architecture.
close_reason: Session 3 complete: Hybrid candidate achieves 7/7 with all verification criteria passing (S2 margin +7.28%, S4 delta 0.072, S6 error 1.1e-16). Code in candidates.py/evaluate.py, documented in FINDINGS.md.

title: Step 7: R17+R18 CausalOverlay query implementation
description: Implement compare_predictions (R17) and implicate_causal_nodes (R18) on CausalOverlay, completing Stage 2-3 query surface. 15 new tests, clippy clean, FINDINGS.md updated.
close_reason: R17 compare_predictions + R18 implicate_causal_nodes implemented. 44/44 tests pass, 0 clippy warnings. Full Stage 2-3 query surface validated.

title: WDK#41 Session 5: Hybrid stretch analyses (calibration + correlation)
description:
Session 2 ran stretch analyses (calibration patterns A/B/C, Fisher correlation robustness with Brown-style correction) against single-family candidates only. The hybrid has not been tested against these.

UPDATED after Session 4: The ceiling analysis (athena-rfp) must resolve first. If the 0.991 upper bound or normalization layer changes, stretch test baselines shift. Run stretch tests against the POST-ceiling-decision hybrid config, not the current one.

Run: (1) deterministic 50-cycle calibration simulation against hybrid — does it handle pattern B instability better than single-family candidates? (2) Correlation robustness at rho {0.0, 0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.9} — does HTG gating prevent the floor-saturation seen in Session 2 Fisher results? (3) If ceiling was raised in athena-rfp, re-verify S5 pass with new bound before running stretch tests.

title: Step 5c: Resolve 5 open threads from Step 5a
description: Resolve/narrow 5 open threads from Step 5a candidate IR schemas using LEL prototype evidence. Thread #31 (overlay cost) via benchmark, #32 (references), #33 (ExperimentSpec), #34 (OverlayEntity), #35 (arena allocation) via analytical reasoning.
close_reason: All 5 threads resolved/narrowed/deferred: #31 overlay cost empirically bounded (81ms at 10^6), #32 from-day-one confirmed, #33 ExperimentSpec sufficient (2 VASP gaps tracked), #34 OverlayEntity sufficient (1 index needed), #35 arena deferred. Benchmark binary and FINDINGS.md updated.

title: Implement AggregateScore decomposition invariant assertion
description:
Implement decomposition invariant validation for AggregateResult: sum(contribution_i) == aggregate_score within tolerance 1e-8. Source: aggregate_score_recommendation.md Section 1.5 and Section 6 note 3; S6 gate precedent from Session 3.

Acceptance criteria:
1) Runtime assertion/validation computes decomposition residual per aggregate call.
2) Residual > 1e-8 fails with explicit contract violation signal.
3) Residual <= 1e-8 passes and is reportable in diagnostics.
4) Invariant is validated in acceptance tests (athena-3lu).
close_reason: Implemented and verified: BF norm seam, x0 guardrail, decomposition invariant. 7/7 PASS, max margin delta 4.414e-07

title: WDK#39: prediction_id type harmonization
description: Document String vs SpecElementId mismatch, analyze parse-at-query-time workaround failure modes, evaluate harmonization options, assess adapter impact.
close_reason: Investigation complete, findings appended to FINDINGS.md

title: Implement AggregateScore revisit-trigger monitoring hooks
description: Implement runtime monitoring signals/contracts for recommendation triggers T1-T5: empirical envelope violations, new DivergenceKind additions, Pattern B blocking requirement, scenario suite expansion, and correlation-structure changes.

title: Step 1a: OpenMM trace format characterization
description: Survey OpenMM trace output: reporter types, exception handling, theory-implementation API boundary (ForceField.createSystem), execution metadata, NaN failure walkthrough. Deliverable: dsl-evaluation/openmm-trace-analysis.md

title: Step 2b: Provenance and scientific workflow IR survey
description: Survey W3C PROV-DM, ProvONE, provenance query literature, FAIR provenance, process mining. Key questions: Entity-Activity-Agent for theory-implementation distinction, causal query languages, scalability for MB-scale traces. Deliverable: working notes + FINDINGS.md entry

title: WDK#26: INCAR classification table completeness
description: Enumerate ambiguous INCAR parameters, specify conditions for theory-affecting vs implementation, assess completeness, propose classification strategy.
close_reason: Investigation complete, findings appended to FINDINGS.md

title: Step 2a: RCA and formal verification IR survey
description: Survey IRs from RCA tools, formal verification (LLVM IR, MLIR, Boogie/Why3), SAT solver proof traces, program analysis. Key questions: causal chain representation, spec-vs-implementation encoding, counter-example trace structure, queryability. Deliverable: working notes + FINDINGS.md entry

title: Step 3b: Requirements refinement with coverage matrix
description: Map 17+ minimum requirements against actual DSL trace content from Step 1. Coverage matrix: each distinction x each framework (directly available / derivable / unavailable). Gap analysis. Feasibility assessment per LFI stage. DECISION GATE 4: Any LFI stage infeasible? Deliverable: FINDINGS.md entry
close_reason: Coverage matrix complete: R1-R29 × {OpenMM, GROMACS, VASP} classified, gap analysis done, Decision Gate 4 PASS. Step 5a (athena-axc) unblocked.

title: WDK#41 S4.1: S5 ceiling analysis — operating regime bounds and architectural options
description:
Session 4 revealed the 0.991 upper bound is the tightest constraint in the system (margin +0.000009 at BF=110, fails at BF=120). This is NOT a parameter sensitivity — it is a fixed sigmoid saturation curve hitting a hard-coded ceiling. S6 joint-compression failures may share this root cause (high bf_strong pushes component scores past the same ceiling).

Investigation needed:
1. Determine what BayesFactor values the DSL environment actually produces. If BF>110 is common, the ceiling must move. If rare, document as an accepted operating constraint.
2. Decompose S6 failures: are they caused by the 0.991 ceiling (same root cause as S5) or by the dominant_share sub-criterion independently?
3. Evaluate architectural options: (a) raise ceiling (changes normalization contract), (b) clamp BF inputs before normalization (preprocessing step), (c) accept constraint with documented operating bounds.
4. Whichever option is chosen, quantify the impact on S2 compounding margin (the ceiling change must not break the +7.28% S2 result).

This blocks the stretch analyses (athena-e2a) — no point running calibration/correlation tests if the ceiling changes the normalization layer.
close_reason: S5 ceiling analysis complete. Log-scaled BF normalization (bf_max=10000) extends ceiling from BF=110 to BF=9999, maintains 7/7 baseline, recovers all 5 S6 failures. GO for athena-e2a.

title: Step 4: Characterize 21% RCA baseline
description: Trace the 21% Top@1 figure to source paper. Understand methodology, datasets, 'unstructured traces' definition. Identify structural properties that improve accuracy. Estimate DSL-specific improvement factors. Identify residual hard cases. DECISION GATE 3: Is baseline transferable to DSL domain? Deliverable: FINDINGS.md entry

title: Research phase scaffolding
description: Create directory structure, ADR, FINDINGS.md files, evaluation spec, and update CLAUDE.md to transition from Pre-Development to Research phase
close_reason: Research scaffolding complete: directory structure, ADR 001, FINDINGS.md, evaluation spec, and CLAUDE.md all in place

title: Step 2c: Comparative IR synthesis
description: Catalog transferable IR patterns (counter-example traces, Entity-Activity-Agent, event chains, SSA, multi-level abstraction, spec-impl separation, causal dependency graphs). Map to LFI audit stages. Identify anti-patterns. DECISION GATE 2: Existing IR adaptable or novel design needed? Deliverable: dsl-evaluation/ir-pattern-catalog.md + FINDINGS.md entry

title: Step 1c: VASP trace format characterization
description: Survey VASP trace output: vasprun.xml structure, OUTCAR/OSZICAR content, failure signaling (SCF non-convergence, ionic relaxation), DFT-specific theory-implementation boundary (INCAR tags), closed-source constraints. Deliverable: dsl-evaluation/vasp-trace-analysis.md

title: Step 1d: Cross-framework trace synthesis
description: Build comparison matrix across OpenMM/GROMACS/VASP: trace elements, formats, theory-implementation layer tags. Produce failure mode taxonomy per framework. Assess trace completeness. DECISION GATE 1: Is theory-implementation boundary cleanly API-enforced? Deliverable: dsl-evaluation/cross-framework-synthesis.md + FINDINGS.md entry

title: WDK#25: VASP closed-source ceiling analysis
description: Enumerate VASP failure modes and classify by whether fault isolation is possible from observable outputs alone. Estimate frequency across typical DFT workflows.
close_reason: Investigation complete, findings appended to FINDINGS.md

title: WDK#41 S4.3: S2 sigmoid guardrail — document x0 >= 0 constraint
description:
Session 4 showed all S2 custom sigmoid failures occur exclusively at x0=-0.2 with k>=2.0. The failure column is narrow and the mechanism is understood: negative x0 shifts the sigmoid midpoint, compressing output range below the 1.5x compounding threshold.

Deliverable: Add explicit operating constraint to hybrid specification — custom_sigmoids must have x0 >= 0. This is a one-line specification addition, not an investigation. Can be folded into athena-6ax (S6 recommendation) if preferred, but capturing separately to ensure it is not lost.

Evidence: perturbation_summary.md S2 grid — 0/4 pass at x0=-0.2 with k>=2.0, 20/20 pass at x0>=0.0.
